monasteries.name: Rumtek Monastery
monasteries.description: The largest monastery in Sikkim and the main seat of the Karma Kagyu lineage. Known for its stunning architecture and sacred relics.

monasteries.name: Pemayangtse Monastery
monasteries.description: One of the oldest and most important monasteries in Sikkim, offering breathtaking views of the Himalayas.

monasteries.name: Enchey Monastery
monasteries.description: A 200-year-old monastery known for its annual Cham dance and beautiful murals depicting Buddhist teachings.

monasteries.name: Tashiding Monastery
monasteries.description: Perched on a hilltop, this sacred monastery is believed to cleanse sins of pilgrims who visit it.

monasteries.name: Ralang Monastery
monasteries.description: Famous for its annual Pang Lhabsol festival and ancient Buddhist texts preserved within its walls.

monasteries.name: Dubdi Monastery
monasteries.description: The first monastery built in Sikkim, showcasing the earliest Buddhist architectural traditions in the region.

monasteries.name: Phensang Monastery
monasteries.description: A remote monastery offering spectacular views of Kanchenjunga and housing ancient Tibetan manuscripts.

monasteries.name: Labrang Monastery
monasteries.description: Known for its meditation caves and peaceful environment, perfect for spiritual contemplation.

monasteries.name: Sang Monastery
monasteries.description: An ancient monastery housing rare Buddhist artifacts and offering insights into Sikkimese spiritual heritage.

monasteries.name: Do-drul Chorten
monasteries.description: A magnificent stupa surrounded by prayer wheels, representing the mind of Buddha and Buddhist cosmology.
